intro: Moronobea montana, commonly known as the mountain moronobea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, heart-shaped leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, although it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
